1. **All FireCut features** - Complete feature list from their website, marketing, and user reviews
2. **Pricing tiers** - What do they charge and what's included?
3. **User complaints** - What do users say is missing or broken?
4. **Unique selling points** - What makes FireCut popular?

Focus on features like:
- Silence removal / jump cuts
- Take detection / best take selection
- Multicam editing
- Caption/subtitle generation
- Profanity bleeping
- Filler word removal
- Zoom effects
- Auto B-roll insertion
- Podcast editing features

Based on the search results, here's a comprehensive overview of FireCut's pricing plans and tiers:

## FireCut Pricing Plans (2025)

FireCut is available in three tiers â€“ Starter, Pro, and Team, with both monthly and yearly options.

### **Starter Plan**
Priced at $14 monthly or $11 per month when billed annually, ideal for those just beginning with video editing.

Features include:
- Silence cutting (basic), silence cutting (advanced), J-cuts Beta, and access to FireCut Discord community.

### **Pro Plan**
Priced at $29 monthly or $24 per month with annual billing, suitable for editing multiple videos each month.(no content)It unlocks advanced AI features, including multi-track editing and AI-driven enhancements.

### **Team Plan**
Designed for agencies or production houses with multiple users, costing $29 per month per user, with discounts for larger teams.

Additional Team features include:
Multi-track editing, AI chapter detection, AI auto-zoom, AI repetition removal, AI filler words removal, captions in 50+ languages, centralized billing, usage monitoring, and admin controls.

### **Additional Information**
- All plans include a free 14-day trial, providing flexibility for different user needs.
- FireCut Plugin features are limited to 25 hours of audio processing per month. Prices are exclusive of sales tax, which is applied at checkout.
- There's also a Lifetime option that gives perpetual access to all FireCut features without worrying about future payments, ideal for those deeply committed to video editing.

Based on the search results, here's a comprehensive list of FireCut AI features for Adobe Premiere Pro in 2025:

## FireCut AI Features for Premiere Pro (2025)

### Core Editing Features

FireCut AI is a co-pilot for Adobe Premiere Pro that automates boring tasks (cutting silences, removing repeated takes, adding captions, detecting chapters, etc.)

**1. Silence Remover**
Automatically removes silences and you can also adjust the settings to get the cuts just right.(no content)The tool offers both "Basic" and "Advanced" tabs for fine-tuning results.

**2. Filler Word Removal**
Finds and removes filler words like "um" and "uh" from your audio.

**3. Remove Repetition**
Finds and removes repeated phrases, helping you make your transcript tighter and more engaging.

**4. Add Zooms**
Automatically adds zooms to specific parts of your video. You can also adjust the frequency and style of the zooms and even make further adjustments.

**5. Chapter Detection**
FireCut can identify key story arcs that you can copy and paste in your YouTube's description box.(no content)It also has the power to create animated title cards for each chapter.

**6. Multicam/Podcast Editing**
FireCut's "Multicam" tool promises a one-click podcast edit with nifty features, especially a speaker-switching frequencies slider and auto-cutaway functionality.

**7. Automated Captions**
Add captions in more than 50 languages.(no content)FireCut AI offers styled and text-only caption options.

**8. Additional Features**
It offers automated editing features, such as removing silences and repetitions, and adding b-rolls, subtitles, texts, animations, music, and more.

### Technical Specifications

Compatible with Adobe Premiere Pro 2022+ on both Windows and MacOS.(no content)FireCut AI is a Premiere Pro plugin developed by Ali Abdaal and his friend Suhail Idrees. It is designed to automate all the time-taking aspects of video editing using AI.

### Pricing
It comes at a monthly price of $34, but you can save 30% with an annual plan.(no content)FireCut Plugin features are limited to 25 hours of audio processing per month.

### Target Users
FireCut AI is best for YouTubers, podcasters, and talking-head editors who deal with long stretches of raw footage.

Based on the search results, here's what I found about FireCut's features for silence removal, jump cuts, and auto zoom:

## FireCut Features Overview

### Silence Removal
Remove silences in FireCut helps you clean up your raw footage by automatically finding and deleting all the silence portions / dead spaces. This single feature saves users hours on every single edit, because doing this step manually is not only a huge time-sink, but also extremely repetitive and boring.(no content)To do a quick clean-up, go to Remove silences, pick a Silence cutting tightness setting (loose, default, tight) and click "Go!" FireCut will analyze your video, find silences, and cut them automatically right in your Premiere Pro sequence.(no content)Basic mode offers one-click operation with 1 main setting: cutting tightness. If you want some short gaps before and after silences in the result, choose a loose cut. If you prefer a fast-paced video with very sharp cuts, pick a tight cut.

### Jump Cuts / J-Cuts
Adding a 1-10 frames offset makes cuts smoother. Cuts in the video can often appear "jumpy" especially if you have a lot of them. Adding a slight offset where the audio comes in earlier can make the cuts feel smoother, creating a subliminal effect of making the video "follow" the audio.(no content)J-cuts only have 1 setting (as part of the review screen in Remove silences > Advanced mode): Offset - the number of frames by which the cut between the audio and video will be offset. A number greater than 0 will cause the audio to be cut earlier than the video by that many frames. Leave this at 0 if you don't want J-cuts.

### Auto Zoom Features
Adding zoom-in at key moments in the video is a popular way of adding some motion to single-camera setups. This FireCut feature uses AI to figure out these key moments in your video, and adds zooms automatically on a new video track using Adjustment Layers.(no content)Zoom frequency lets you decide how often FireCut should add a zoom. Low frequency is for slow-paced (typically long-form) content, adding ~1 zoom per minute. The middle (default) setting adds ~2 to 4 zooms per minute. High frequency is for fast-paced (typically short-form) content, adding ~7 zooms per minute.(no content)The Animated setting controls whether to gradually zoom in with an animation, or add a sharp zoom cut without an animation. If animated, this applies keyframes to the Adjustment Layers that are added. Animation duration controls the length of the animation, with a good starting point being 0.2 to 0.5 sec.

### Platform Support
FireCut is a well-known plugin which was initially released for Premiere Pro. It uses AI to automate the time-taking tasks in a routine video editing workflow. Recently, FireCut released a DaVinci Resolve version.(no content)It works with Adobe Premiere Pro 2022+ on Windows and MacOS.

# FireCut Pricing Tiers and Features

## Pricing Plans

**FireCut for DaVinci Resolve**
- Monthly: $34/mo
- Yearly: $17/mo (50% off)
- End of Year offer: 50% discount available

**FireCut for Premiere Pro**
- Monthly: $34/mo (standard) or $44/mo (with TTS)
- Yearly: $17/mo (standard) or $22/mo (with TTS)
- End of Year offer: 50% discount available

**Add-on: AI Speech Generation**
- Cost: +$10/mo
- Includes: "Generate AI voiceovers for your videos. 25,000 characters included per month"

## Core Features (Both Plans)

- Full integration with respective editing software
- Silence cutting
- Captions in 50+ languages with auto emojis
- Podcast automatic editing
- Clip highlights from longform
- Premium B-rolls (DaVinci) or B-rolls and background music (Premiere)
- Filler word/profanity/repetition removal
- Chapter detection for YouTube SEO
- Zoom cuts

## Limitations

"FireCut Plugin features are limited to 25 hours of audio processing per month"

Based on my search, here's information about FireCut's multicam podcast editing features including auto cutaway and speaker detection:

## FireCut Multi-Track Podcast Editing

Multi-track video editing lets you edit podcast-style videos automatically, by switching between multiple video tracks based on multiple audio tracks.(no content)FireCut will "follow" the loudest audio (similar to how video conferencing tools like Zoom and MS Teams will show the speaker on the screen), plus add some variations in the final cut to prevent monotony.

### Speaker Detection

Here are the search results for FireCut's B-roll, auto insert stock footage, chapters, and markers features:

## FireCut B-Roll / Stock Footage Features

FireCut can automatically find stock footage to use in your video based on its content.(no content)FireCut analyzes your video to find key concepts that can be demonstrated with stock footage, then finds you the best stock videos that would go well with your main video (A-roll) and adds them automatically to your sequence at the right times.(no content)You can even review the results list and pick alternative stock footage to swap in.

### Personal B-Roll Library
You can build a "Personal" B-roll library in FireCut by adding a folder to be processed. This folder is scanned for videos which are then tagged automatically with FireCut's AI. You can also add/modify tags yourself for better control.

### B-Roll Frequency Settings
Similar to the frequency in the "Add zooms" feature, this lets you decide how often you want a B-roll clip to be placed in your sequence.

## Chapter Detection & Markers

Dividing your timeline into chapters can be very helpful. When you're close to a final cut, chapter detection can give you markers that you can export as timestamps for YouTube (so YouTube can mark them as chapters in the video), and can even generate pretty motion graphics clips you can show at the start of each chapter.(no content)You can also use it early in the process to put markers on your timeline (e.g. to mark things like "Introduction", "Topic 1, 2, 3, ...", "Sponsor segment", "Conclusion") for reference while you edit your video. These are just like any other markers and can be moved around and edited.(no content)The plugin transcribes the video and automatically generates chapters based on the transcription. Users can then review, adjust, and add markers for each chapter. The chapters can be copied and pasted into a text editor and then directly into a YouTube video description for easy navigation.

### Highlight Markers
FireCut adds red chapter markers named "FC Highlight" at the suggested start/end times. You can review, move, add or delete highlights, then generate new sequence(s). Optional features include re-frame to 9:16, add captions, find B-roll, and auto-generate descriptions.

## Overall Capabilities

Firecut is described as an automatic AI video editing tool that can remove silences, add cap cut style captions, remove repetitions, and filler words, add b-roll clips from stock libraries, and add AI chapters to the project.(no content)The plugin can analyze scripts, identify keywords, and automatically place relevant B-roll footage from stock libraries into the timeline. The integration with DaVinci Resolve is seamless, working with both the free and paid Studio versions.

## FireCut Profanity Removal Features

FireCut scans your video for profanity, and lets you mute or bleep it in seconds.

### Censoring Methods
Mute only mutes the profanity words in the audio while Bleep mutes the words and also overlays them with the selected bleeping sound.

### Bleep Sound Options
Various overlaying sounds are available for the bleeping method: beep, quack, dolphin & ahooga.

### Custom Control
FireCut gives you granular control with custom allow and block lists. Maybe certain words are acceptable for your audience, or perhaps you want to flag industry-specific terms that aren't typically considered profanity but don't fit your brand. ### Language Support
FireCut's AI analyzes your audio across multiple languages and identifies curse words with precision.

### Scope Options
You can decide whether to run the operation on your Full sequence or only on a certain portion that you specify with In / Out points.

FireCut lets you add captions to your video. content.content:
# FireCut Zoom Feature Settings

## Zoom Frequency
Controls how often zooms are added:
- **Low frequency**: ~1 zoom per minute (slow-paced, long-form content)
- **Middle (default)**: ~2-4 zooms per minute
- **High frequency**: ~7 zooms per minute (fast-paced, short-form content)

## Zoom Style Settings

**Scale**: "How far in to zoom. This works exactly like the Scale property on any video, where 100 is 1x size (or no scaling), and 200 is 2x size." Recommended starting point: 120

**Center Point**: Choose where to zoom within the frame; defaults to center but can be adjusted to focus on speaker's face

**Animation**: Toggle between gradual zoom-in with keyframes or sharp cuts without animation

## Animation Configuration

**Duration**: Controls animation length; "A good starting point is 0.8 sec"

**Animation Duration (if animated)**: Separate timing control; "A good starting point is 0.2 to 0.5 sec"

**Easing Function**: Adjusts timing curve from linear (constant rate) to smooth ramp; middle option recommended

## Processing Scope
- **Full sequence**: Process entire timeline
- **In/Out points**: Process only selected portion using I and O hotkeys

## Language Support
Experimental support for multiple languages; English provides most reliable results

content.content:
# FireCut Silence Removal Guide

## Core Functionality
FireCut's **Remove Silences** feature automatically detects and cuts silent portions from footage. The system works by monitoring designated audio tracks and removing sections when "all guidance tracks are silent, that portion of your sequence is cut out."

## Operating Modes

### Basic Mode
One-click operation focusing on a single setting: **cutting tightness**. Users select between loose cuts (preserving short gaps around silences) or tight cuts (creating sharp, fast-paced edits). The tool detects and removes silences in a single operation.

### Advanced Mode
A three-step workflow offering greater customization:
1. Detect silences using configurable parameters
2. Review detected silences in a list and customize retention/padding
3. Execute the cuts

Advanced mode is recommended for longer sequences (1+ hour) to preview results before processing.

## Key Settings

**Silence Threshold (dBFS):** The audio level below which FireCut marks content as silent. "A good starting point is -30 dBFS." The system provides auto-detection via frequency analysis charts showing peak loudness distributions.

**Minimum Silence Duration:** Recommended minimum of 750ms to avoid cutting between words. Smaller values create excessive cuts at natural speech breaks.

**Padding:** Default recommendation is "250ms on start AND 250ms on end" to preserve word boundaries and create breathing room between clips.

**Cutting Algorithm Options:**
- Original: Most reliable but slower, suitable for sequences under 10 minutes with fewer than 50 silences
- Rapid: Faster alternative for 10-30 minute sequences with 50-100 silences
- Turbo: Experimental fastest option for sequences 30+ minutes with 100+ silences

**J-cuts Offset:** Creates audio-video timing variations by offsetting video clips while maintaining silence cut positions.

## Usage Tips
- Test settings on 5-minute samples before processing full sequences
- Avoid creating 500+ cuts (causes Premiere Pro slowdown)
- Don't work in the timeline during processing
- Use Advanced mode for large projects

Based on my search results, here's what I found about FireCut's repetition removal and filler word detection settings:

## FireCut Filler Words Detection

After selecting the audio track, the plugin analyzes the audio to identify filler words such as 'um' and 'uh'. Users can then choose to mark these words for removal and either add markers or directly cut them out of the video.(no content)FireCut's Filler Word Detection identifies and flags common filler words like "um," "uh," "you know," allowing you to quickly remove them for a more polished and professional speech delivery.(no content)You can right-click words to select/deselect them for deletion. FireCut also lets you place markers in the sequence where these words occur, if you only want to mark them and double check them later.

## FireCut Repetition Removal Settings

Remove repetition detects when the speaker is repeating phrases in the video, and allows you to select one "take" to keep while deleting the others.(no content)Advanced mode (default) lets you investigate your transcript and customize repetition detection settings, such as tolerance and search radius. You can also decide whether to run the operation on your full sequence or only on a certain portion that you specify with In/Out points.

In advanced mode, you get 4 further settings to fine-tune detection of repeated phrases:
- **Minimum phrase size**: The minimum number of words that have to be repeated in order to be detected as a "match"
- **Tolerance**(no content)The advanced option allows users to customize the phrase size, tolerance, and search radius for better accuracy.(no content)Because this feature's use case is to remove repeated takes, it will detect repetition only when it is consecutive (i.e., the speaker has done a few takes right next to each other). If you do a second take 5 minutes after the first one, and there are other things being discussed in between, FireCut won't mark these.

## Additional Tips

Before selecting your favourite take, make sure FireCut has marked the start and end of that take exactly as you want it (by clicking on the take in the list, which will mark it on your timeline). After completing the process, do a double-check to ensure your take has the right start and end points.

# FireCut Remove Filler Words - Settings & Configuration

## Settings

FireCut's Remove Filler Words feature offers two main configuration options:

1. **Filler Words Guidance Audio Tracks**: "The audio tracks you want FireCut to listen to for filler words. Whenever all of these tracks are silent, that portion of the sequence will be marked for cutting."

2. **Scope**: Users can choose between running the operation on the "Full sequence" or a specific portion using In/Out points (set via `I` and `O` hotkeys).

## Supported Filler Words

The documentation specifically mentions detecting words like "umm" and "uhh" but does not provide a comprehensive list of all supported filler words. The feature "helps you find words like 'umm' and 'uhh' in your sequence that are typically unwanted."

## Language Support

No explicit language support information is provided in the documentation. The interface appears to be in English, but specific language capabilities are not detailed.

## Notable Limitations

- Currently in beta status with potential for missed detections
- May struggle with transcription accuracy if audio contains long silences, music, or sound effects
- Users should remove repetitions before processing for optimal results

content.content:
# FireCut Chapter Detection: Settings & Features

## Detection Settings

FireCut's chapter detection includes two primary configurations:

**Scope Options:**
You can choose to analyze your "Full sequence" or specify a particular section using In/Out points (set via `I` and `O` hotkeys in your editing software).

**Language Support:**
The tool supports multiple languages, though results are experimental outside English. FireCut notes that "training sets for AI tend to be in English," which can affect reliability with non-English content.

## Output Actions

Once topics are detected and reviewed, you have three options:

1. **Copy timestamps** - Extract chapter data as text for pasting into YouTube descriptions
2. **Create markers** - Place timeline markers at detected chapter points for navigation
3. **Generate motion graphics** - Automated animated title cards appear on a new video track above your sequence

## Key Considerations

- Processing takes roughly 2 minutes per 10 minutes of sequence
- Motion graphics clips are editable after placement (font size, text changes supported)
- Best results require clear audio without excessive background noise, multiple speakers, or music interference
- Recommended for sequences under 20 minutes in length

FireCut suggests running chapter detection near the end of your editing workflow, after removing silences and repetitions.

content.content:
# FireCut Remove Repetition: Detection Settings

## Core Settings Overview

FireCut offers two operational modes for repetition detection:

**Basic Mode**: Described as a "done for you" solution applying optimal sensitivity settings automatically.

**Advanced Mode** (default): Provides customizable fine-tuning with four key parameters.

## Advanced Mode Parameters

### 1. Minimum Phrase Size
"The minimum number of words that have to be repeated in order to be detected as a 'match'"

### 2. Tolerance
Controls matching strictness:
- **0%**: Only exact matches detected
- **80%**: Even loose repetitions detected (may catch false positives)

### 3. Search Radius
Determines how far the algorithm searches for matching phrases. Increasing this value allows FireCut to identify repetitions even when they're separated by other content.

### 4. Extend Last Occurrence
Three options for defining where the final repetition ends:
- **Extend to end of sentence**: Uses the next period as the endpoint
- **Use longest occurrence length**: Assumes the last take matches the longest previous version
- **Use phrase size**: Applies the minimum phrase size setting

## Take Selection Workflow

Users preview each detected repetition by clicking it, which marks the section on the timeline. After selecting the preferred "take," users confirm with a tick button, which automatically deletes all other instances of that phrase.

content.content:
# FireCut Caption Settings & Features

## Caption Modes

**Styled Captions**: Animated captions as PNG images in a new video track, editable within FireCut.

**Text-Only Mode**: Native captions track (requires Premiere Pro 2022+) for custom styling in the editor.

## Key Settings

**Scope**: Apply to full sequence or specify In/Out points using `I` and `O` hotkeys.

**Audio Language**: "FireCut also lets you transcribe audio in 50+ languages" though non-English transcription is experimental and "expected to be 70-80% correct in most cases."

**Guidance Prompt**: Customize transcript style by providing:
- Brand names/proper nouns (e.g., "FireCut" to correct "fire cut")
- Capitalization preferences
- Punctuation guidance

**Translation**: Convert captions to different languages after setting source audio language.

**Voice Activity Detection (VAD)**: Eliminates issues from long silences like word repetition.

## Styling & Customization

- Font, text position, and animation adjustments
- Save custom styles as reusable Presets via the "+" button
- Edit existing PNG captions by selecting them and using "Edit selected captions"

## Export Options

"You can also export the captions as SRT or VTT files"

## Processing

Two-step automatic transcription: sentence-level (~5s/min audio) then word-level (~5s/min) for accurate timing.

content.content:
# FireCut Multi-track Video Editing Settings

## Speaker Detection
FireCut analyzes audio tracks to identify the loudest speaker at any moment, similar to how video conferencing tools show the active speaker. It automatically switches between corresponding video tracks based on audio prominence.

## Key Settings

**Speaker Switching Frequency**
Controls sensitivity when transitioning between speakers. Increasing this value causes more frequent cuts as soon as another speaker becomes louder than the current one; decreasing it results in fewer switches.

**Cutaway Settings**
- **Max Shot Duration**: Establishes a time limit for displaying any single clip. When exceeded, FireCut inserts cutaways from other video tracks to maintain viewer engagement
- **Cutaway Shot Duration**: Determines how long each inserted cutaway segment should play

**Cutting Operation**
Choose how to handle inactive video segments (when speakers aren't being shown):
- **Disable**: Keep clips in the timeline but grey them out so Premiere Pro ignores them
- **Delete**: Remove inactive segments entirely

## Best Practices
Ensure audio tracks have similar loudness levels; normalize audio quality to avoid background noise interfering with speaker detection; optionally pre-edit audio tracks for greater control over speaker focus timing.

Based on the search results, here's what I found about FireCut limitations, problems, and performance issues:

## FireCut Performance Issues

### Main Problem Reported
Users have reported that when using the FireCut plugin to cut out silences in Adobe Premiere Pro, the timeline becomes "unusably laggy" when trying to sort through the footage. Projects may have more than 1,000 cuts, which can cause significant lag.

### Key Observations from Users

1. **High-end hardware doesn't prevent the issue**: Even users with powerful systems (RTX 4090, i9 14900K processor, 64 GB of RAM) have experienced unusable lag after using FireCut to cut out silences.

2. **Playback settings don't help**: Users have tried putting playback resolution down to 1/4, but still experience lag issues.

3. **Plugin behavior may cause issues**: Users report that manual cutting with individual video files works fine, suggesting the plugin causes the issues. The plugin creator mentioned it "recreates the footage except with cuts," which may be duplicating everything.

4. **Multiple video sources compound the problem**: Having multiple video sources (e.g., 3 1080p sources consolidated together) combined with the plugin's cuts can exacerbate the lag.

### Potential Solutions (from FireCut's own blog)

One potential solution is resetting the workspace layout, as a "buggy" workspace layout might be the root cause. The process involves selecting "reset to saved layout" to fix potential GUI problems.(no content)Another fix involves checking audio configuration, as there may be an input set incorrectly causing the lag. Ensuring audio is input correctly might help alleviate such issues.(no content)Clearing the cache could also help enhance performance, as a cache filled with unnecessary files can slow down the application, leading to lagging issues.

FireCut's "Create highlights" feature finds the most engaging moments in your sequence and turns them into short, ready-to-share clips. It's ideal for shorts, reels, teasers, and social cut-downs.

### How It Works

FireCut analyzes your audio transcript to spot compelling, self-contained moments. It adds red chapter markers named "FC Highlight" at the suggested start/end times. You can review, move, add or delete highlights, then generate new sequence(s).

### Key Settings

- **Number of highlights**: Approximate frequency per hour of footage (slider). **Highlight duration**: Minimum/maximum target length (5â€“120s).
- Pick a sensible duration range (e.g., 15â€“60s) to get tighter, punchier clips. Turn on Enhanced accuracy to get better timing accuracy for the highlights.

### Vertical Video Reframing

For vertical export, re-frame to 9:16; use Auto Reframe for speed, Custom for control.(no content)You can export these highlights into new sequences, reframe them to vertical video (9:16), add captions based on your selected preset, find B-roll from their premium Storyblocks collection, and generate descriptions with AI for posting to social media â€” all in a single click.

### Use Case

If you're currently making YouTube long-form content and you want better audience reach, you need to create shorts from that content and post it to YouTube Shorts, Instagram Reels and TikTok. FireCut helps you find the moments in your video with the most potential for virality. You can then export these highlights into their own videos for posting to short-form platforms.

### About FireCut

FireCut is an AI-powered video editing tool for Premiere Pro, enabling users to remove silences, filler words, and repetitions, add zooms, chapters, captions, and b-roll.(no content)FireCut was founded in 2023 to help creators and video editors save time by getting to their first cut faster.

# FireCut Create Highlights Settings

## Detection Settings

**Number of highlights**: "Approximate frequency per hour of footage (slider)"

**Highlight duration**: "Minimum/maximum target length (5â€“120s)"

**Scope**: Full sequence or In/Out points configured in your timeline

**Accuracy**: Enhanced option available for "slower, more precise" timing

**Language**: Adjustable spoken language setting (non-English currently experimental)

## Edit Highlights

- **Highlights list**: Jump to highlights, move red markers, delete via "X"
- **Add new**: Select range with In/Out points â†’ "+ Add new highlight"
- **Overlap guard**: Generation disabled if highlights overlap

## Create Sequences

**Vertical reframing (9:16)**:
- Premiere Pro Auto Reframe with motion tracking speed options (slower/default/faster)
- Custom re-framing (Beta) with viewboxes and face detection

**Additional options**:
- Apply FireCut captions style to each highlight
- Auto-suggest B-roll for each highlight
- "Create text descriptions for social posts; copy/regenerate"
- Generate one sequence per highlight or combined single sequence
- Output to "Highlights" bin with descriptive naming

content.content:
# FireCut Find Music: Background Settings & Options

## Mood & Genre Detection

**Automatic Mode** analyzes your clip's "genre and mood" to recommend matching tracks. The system transcribes your selected sequence (Full Sequence or In/Out Scope) to understand the tonal context.

**Manual Mode** lets users select from predefined options:
- **Genres**: cinematic, lo-fi, corporate, ambient
- **Moods**: uplifting, tense, emotional, mysterious

## Track Management

The feature provides curated music recommendations based on your preferences. Users can "preview each track and insert it into your timeline with one click" from the results displayed below the selection interface.

## YouTube Whitelisting

Users can manage channel permissions by:
- Adding YouTube Channel IDs (format: starts with 'UC' + alphanumeric characters)
- Viewing currently whitelisted channels
- Tracking when channels were added

This ensures "proper permissions and licensing for using music tracks in your YouTube videos" and prevents copyright strikes.

## Optimization Tips

- Use In/Out points (hotkeys I and O) to limit analysis to relevant video sections
- Ensure clear voiceover for accurate tone understanding
- Verify correct Channel ID format when whitelisting

content.text:
Now I have comprehensive information. Let me compile the complete FireCut feature analysis.

---

# FireCut AI - Complete Feature Analysis

## Overview

FireCut is an AI-powered video editing plugin for Adobe Premiere Pro (and recently DaVinci Resolve), developed by Ali Abdaal and Suhail Idrees. It automates repetitive editing tasks like cutting silences, removing filler words, adding captions, and more.

---

## Pricing Tiers (2025)

| Plan | Monthly | Yearly (per month) | Target User |
|------|---------|-------------------|-------------|
| **Standard** | $34/mo | $17/mo (50% off) | Individual creators |
| **With TTS Add-on** | $44/mo | $22/mo | Creators needing voiceovers |

**Add-ons:**
- AI Speech Generation: +$10/mo (25,000 characters/month)

**Limits:**
- All plans: 25 hours of audio processing per month
- 14-day free trial available

**Previous tier structure (may be outdated):**
- Starter: $14/mo ($11 yearly) - Basic silence cutting only
- Pro: $29/mo ($24 yearly) - All features
- Team: $29/user/mo - Multi-user with admin controls

---

## Complete Feature List

### 1. Silence Removal (Core Feature)

**Basic Mode:**
- One-click operation
- Single setting: Cutting tightness (loose/default/tight)
- Loose = preserves short gaps, Tight = fast-paced sharp cuts

**Advanced Mode (3-step workflow):**
1. Detect silences with configurable parameters
2. Review detected silences in list
3. Execute cuts

**Settings:**
| Setting | Description | Default/Recommended |
|---------|-------------|---------------------|
| Silence Threshold | dBFS level for silence detection | -30 dBFS |
| Minimum Silence Duration | Prevents cutting between words | 750ms |
| Padding (Start) | Buffer before speech | 250ms |
| Padding (End) | Buffer after speech | 250ms |
| Guidance Audio Tracks | Which tracks to monitor | User-selectable |

**Cutting Algorithms:**
- **Original**: Most reliable, slower. For <10 min, <50 silences
- **Rapid**: Faster. For 10-30 min, 50-100 silences
- **Turbo**: Experimental fastest. For 30+ min, 100+ silences

**J-Cuts (Beta):**
- Offset: 1-10 frames where audio cuts earlier than video
- Creates smoother transitions between cuts

---

### 2. Filler Word Removal

**Detected Words:**
- "um", "uh", "umm", "uhh", and similar hesitation sounds

**Actions:**
- Mark words for removal
- Place markers only (for manual review)
- Directly cut from timeline

**Limitations:**
- Beta status - may miss some detections
- Struggles with long silences, music, or sound effects
- Best results after removing repetitions first

---

### 3. Repetition/Take Detection

**Purpose:** Finds when speaker repeats phrases (multiple takes) and lets you select the best one

**Basic Mode:** Automatic optimal sensitivity

**Advanced Mode Settings:**
| Setting | Description |
|---------|-------------|
| Minimum Phrase Size | Min words to count as repetition |
| Tolerance | 0% = exact match, 80% = loose match (more false positives) |
| Search Radius | How far to look for matching phrases |
| Extend Last Occurrence | How to determine end point (sentence end/longest/phrase size) |

**Workflow:**
1. Click detected repetition to preview
2. Select preferred take
3. Confirm to delete all other instances

**Note:** Only detects consecutive repetitions (not separated by other content)

---

### 4. Profanity Detection & Bleeping

**Censoring Methods:**
- **Mute**: Silences profanity words
- **Bleep**: Mutes and overlays with sound

**Bleep Sounds:**
- Beep (classic)
- Quack
- Dolphin
- Ahooga

**Customization:**
- Allow list (words to ignore)
- Block list (additional words to flag)
- Individual word selection/deselection

**Language Support:** Multiple languages via AI analysis

---

### 5. Auto Zoom

**Frequency Settings:**
| Level | Rate | Use Case |
|-------|------|----------|
| Low | ~1 zoom/min | Long-form content |
| Medium (default) | 2-4 zooms/min | Standard content |
| High | ~7 zooms/min | Short-form/fast-paced |

**Zoom Settings:**
| Setting | Description | Recommended |
|---------|-------------|-------------|
| Scale | Zoom level (100 = no zoom, 200 = 2x) | 120 |
| Center Point | Where to zoom (center/custom) | Center or face |
| Animation | Gradual vs sharp cut | User preference |
| Duration | Total zoom duration | 0.8 sec |
| Animation Duration | Keyframe animation length | 0.2-0.5 sec |
| Easing | Timing curve (linear to smooth) | Middle |

**Implementation:** Uses Adjustment Layers on new video track

---

### 6. Captions/Subtitles

**Caption Types:**
- **Styled Captions**: PNG images on video track (highly customizable animations)
- **Text-Only**: Native Premiere Pro captions track

**Features:**
- 50+ languages (non-English ~70-80% accuracy)
- Translation to different language
- Auto emoji insertion
- Custom style presets (save/reuse)
- Guidance prompts (brand names, capitalization)
- Voice Activity Detection (VAD) for silence handling

**Export Formats:**
- SRT
- VTT

**Processing:** ~5 sec/min audio (sentence + word level)

---

### 7. Chapter Detection

**Output Options:**
1. **Copy timestamps** - For YouTube description
2. **Create markers** - Timeline navigation
3. **Generate motion graphics** - Animated title cards

**Settings:**
- Scope: Full sequence or In/Out points
- Language support (experimental for non-English)

**Processing:** ~2 min per 10 min of sequence

**Best Practice:** Run near end of workflow, after silence/repetition removal

---

### 8. Multi-Track / Podcast Editing

**Core Function:** Automatically switches between video tracks based on audio loudness (like Zoom/Teams speaker detection)

**Settings:**
| Setting | Description |
|---------|-------------|
| Speaker Switching Frequency | How sensitive to speaker changes |
| Max Shot Duration | Time limit before forced cutaway |
| Cutaway Shot Duration | Length of cutaway clips |
| Cutting Operation | Disable (grey out) or Delete inactive segments |

**How It Works:**
1. Tag video tracks to corresponding audio tracks
2. Label speakers by name
3. FireCut analyzes loudness per track
4. Switches to loudest speaker's camera
5. Adds cutaways when max duration exceeded

**Note:** Works on any language (follows loudness, not words)

---

### 9. Create Highlights (Short-Form Content)

**Purpose:** Extract viral moments for Shorts/Reels/TikTok

**Detection Settings:**
| Setting | Description |
|---------|-------------|
| Number of highlights | Frequency per hour |
| Highlight duration | 5-120 seconds range |
| Enhanced accuracy | Slower but more precise timing |

**Export Options:**
- Vertical reframe to 9:16 (Auto Reframe or Custom with face detection)
- Apply FireCut captions
- Auto-suggest B-roll
- AI-generated descriptions for social posts
- Single sequence or one per highlight

---

### 10. B-Roll / Stock Footage

**How It Works:**
1. FireCut analyzes content for key concepts
2. Finds matching stock videos
3. Inserts at appropriate times

**Sources:**
- Premium Storyblocks collection
- Personal B-roll library (local folder with AI tagging)

**Settings:**
- B-roll frequency (similar to zoom frequency)
- Review and swap alternatives

**Personal Library:**
- Add local folders
- AI auto-tags videos
- Manual tag editing for better control

---

### 11. Background Music (Find Music)

**Modes:**
- **Automatic**: AI detects genre/mood from content
- **Manual**: User selects genre and mood

**Genres:** Cinematic, Lo-fi, Corporate, Ambient
**Moods:** Uplifting, Tense, Emotional, Mysterious

**Features:**
- Preview tracks before insertion
- One-click timeline insert
- YouTube channel whitelisting for permissions

---

### 12. AI Speech Generation (Add-on)

**Cost:** +$10/mo
**Limit:** 25,000 characters/month
**Purpose:** Generate AI voiceovers for videos

---

### 13. Multi-Track Audio Muting

**Purpose:** Removes background noise by muting silent portions per track

**How It Works:**
- Analyzes each audio track separately
- Creates cuts at silence points
- Mutes newly-created silent clips
- Auto or manual threshold detection

---

## Known Issues & User Complaints

### Performance Problems
- **Laggy timeline after many cuts**: Users with 1000+ cuts report unusable lag in Premiere Pro, even on high-end systems (RTX 4090, i9 14900K, 64GB RAM)
- **Recommendation**: Avoid 500+ cuts per sequence
- **Workaround**: Test on 5-min samples first

### Customer Service
- Multiple reports of dead/unresponsive customer support
- License key issues with no email responses
- Discord and WebChat support reportedly non-functional

### Feature Limitations
- Limited customization for cutaway in/out points
- Caption animations lack manual adjustment
- Multicam switching can feel repetitive (predictable pattern)
- Non-English transcription: 70-80% accuracy (experimental)

---

## Unique Selling Points

1. **Speed**: Automates hours of manual editing in minutes
2. **All-in-One**: Silence, filler, profanity, zooms, captions, chapters, B-roll in one plugin
3. **Premiere Pro Native**: Direct integration, not external workflow
4. **Ali Abdaal Association**: Created by popular YouTuber, trusted by creators
5. **DaVinci Resolve Support**: Recently added (not just Premiere)

---

- [FireCut Remove Silences Documentation](https://learn.firecut.ai/features/remove-silences)
- [FireCut Add Zooms Documentation](https://learn.firecut.ai/features/add-zooms)

- [FireCut Create Highlights](https://learn.firecut.ai/features/create-highlights)
- [FireCut Find B-Roll](https://learn.firecut.ai/features/find-b-roll)
